newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Puma dies in Vietnam after battle for custody.
newsitem.headline: Puma dies in Vietnam after battle for custody.

text.p: Police and a group of 20 "rebels" battled for custody of a puma on Vietnam's border with China, but the animal died before it could be released back into the jungle, the official daily Vietnam News said on Monday.
It said the incident had been the most difficult of 19 animal smuggling cases for customs officials in the northern province of Quang Ninh last year.
"The most difficult was the case of Hoang Thi Thuy, who tried to sneak a puma through to China," it said. "Thuy then employed 20 rebels to attack policemen after they'd confiscated the rare animal."

Customs officials in Quang Ninh were not available to comment on the report, which said smugglers had tried to get through the border last year with everything from bears and weasel-like pekans to pangolins, similar to ant-eaters, and lizards.
Vietnam News did not give further details about the puma incident.
Traffickers can earn huge sums for rare animals in China, where their bones and intestines are used in traditional medicine.
